A judge has blocked the New Hampshire law that would add extra steps to the registration process for first time voters as cases McDermott of New Hampshire public radio reports the ruling comes amid concerns that the statute with dampen turnout among certain groups of voters
The law added new language to New Hampshire it's voter registration forms an stiff penalties for people who didn't present proof they lived where they were trying to vote
The state Democratic Party and the local chapter of the league of women voters filed suit to block the law last fall arguing that it was too confusing and would drive away legitimate voters they also argued that it was passed under the guise of preventing voter fraud despite a lack of evidence that such fraud is a serious problem

The Trump Administration is changing Affordable Care act rules to make it easier for healthy middle income Americans define less costly health insurance
